snippet: New measures to combat the disease included house-to-house searches, advisories against travel and the deployment of the army and the police.
abstract: West Africa presses effort to curb spread of Ebola virus as death toll rises to 729, deploying soldiers and authorizing house-to-house searches for infected people and advising against travel; no vaccine exists, and the only way to stop outbreak is to isolate each infected patient, trace all their contacts, isolate ones who get sick and repeat process until, finally, there are no more cases.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and DENISE GRADY
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Abuja, and Denise Grady from New York. Reporting was contributed by Brian Knowlton from Washington, Alan Cowell from London, Dan Bilefsky from Paris, Marc Santora from New York, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: New measures to combat the disease included house-to-house searches, advisories against travel and the deployment of the army and the police.

headline.main: Emergency Efforts in Africa to Contain Ebola as Toll Rises
headline.print_headline: Africa Presses Effort to Curb Ebola’s Spread

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
